Package command

The command package contains all the commands that implement the ICommand interface. This makes use of the Command design pattern.
See Also:
refactoring.guru tutorial about the Command pattern
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ICommand
    ICommand is the interface implemented by all commands.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AddEventPerformanceCommand
    AddEventPerformanceCommand allows EntertainmentProviders to add performances to an existing event that they have created.
    BookEventCommand
    BookEventCommand allows Consumers to book tickets for a specific EventPerformance.
    CancelBookingCommand
    CancelBookingCommand allows Consumers to cancel a Booking given its unique booking number.
    CancelEventCommand
    CancelEventCommand allows EntertainmentProviders to cancel a previously added Event (and all corresponding EventPerformances).
    CreateEventCommand
    CreateEventCommand contains common behaviour shared by commands to create different kinds of events.
    CreateNonTicketedEventCommand
    CreateNonTicketedEventCommand allows EntertainmentProviders to create NonTicketedEvents.
    CreateTicketedEventCommand
    CreateTicketedEventCommand allows EntertainmentProviders to create TicketedEvents.
    GetAvailablePerformanceTicketsCommand
    GetAvailablePerformanceTicketsCommand allows users (even if they are not logged in) to see up-to-date information about how many tickets are available for a specific TicketedEvent EventPerformance.
    GovernmentReport1Command  
    GovernmentReport2Command  
    ListConsumerBookingsCommand
    ListConsumerBookingsCommand allows a logged-in Consumer to get a list of all their own Bookings.
    ListEventBookingsCommand
    ListEventBookingsCommand allows an event organiser (EntertainmentProvider) or GovernmentRepresentative to get a list of all Bookings for a chosen TicketedEvent.
    ListEventsCommand
    ListEventsCommand allows anyone to get a list of Events available on the system.
    ListEventsOnGivenDateCommand
    ListEventsOnGivenDateCommand extends ListEventsCommand to allow retrieving Events on a given particular LocalDateTime +- 1 day
    ListSponsorshipRequestsCommand
    ListSponsorshipRequestsCommand allows GovernmentRepresentatives to get a list of registered SponsorshipRequests.
    LoginCommand
    LoginCommand allows a previously registered User to log in to the system by providing their login details.
    LogoutCommand
    LogoutCommand allows the currently logged in User to log out
    RegisterConsumerCommand
    RegisterConsumerCommand allows users to register a new Consumer account on the system.
    RegisterEntertainmentProviderCommand
    RegisterEntertainmentProviderCommand allows users to register a new EntertainmentProvider account on the system.
    RespondSponsorshipCommand
    RespondSponsorshipCommand allows GovernmentRepresentatives to accept or reject a pending SponsorshipRequest.
    UpdateConsumerProfileCommand
    UpdateConsumerProfileCommand allows Consumers to update their account details and change the default Covid-19 preferences.
    UpdateEntertainmentProviderProfileCommand
    UpdateEntertainmentProviderProfileCommand allows EntertainmentProviders to update their account details in the system.
    UpdateProfileCommand
    UpdateProfileCommand contains common behaviour shared between profile update commands
